In the present case, Fe 3 d forms the bottom of the LUMO, significantly below the unoccupied s levels of the other cations, as shown in Supplementary Fig. S7. Therefore, partial substitutions of trivalent cations, which can shift up the location of the LUMO from the Fe 3 d levels, for Fe may be effective to increase the band-gap.
